cwe_description: The software reads data from a buffer using an index or pointer that references a memory location after the end or before the beginning of the buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or arbitrary code execution.
explanation: The code accesses skb->data to read pkt_type without first verifying that skb->len is at least 1. If skb->len is 0, dereferencing skb->data will result in an out-of-bounds read, potentially leading to a crash (denial of service) or information leak.

cwe_description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or execution of arbitrary code.
explanation: The code dereferences skb->data to read pkt_type without validating that skb->len is at least 1. If skb->len is 0, this will lead to an out-of-bounds read, potentially causing a system crash or information disclosure.
